RelatedSentence: Beginning in 1967 , the federal Freedom of Information Act ( FOIA ) empowered the public to request access to government documents .
Beginning in 1967 , the federal Freedom of Information Act ( FOIA ) empowered the public to request access to government documents .
This came to exemplify the adversarial relationship between the public and government .

Yet public records requests ( also known as FOIL , Right - to - Know , public information or open records requests , depending on where you are ) remain a fundamental way in which the public is able to obtain information from government agencies under FOIA - like laws in all fifty states .
Asheville CIO Jonathan Feldman has outlined some of the challenges that cities face during the process of responding to requests , but in many places the reality is even messier .
Asheville CIO Jonathan Feldman has outlined some of the challenges that cities face during the process of responding to requests , but in many places the reality is even messier .

In April 2013 , the Office of the Public Advocate for New York City issued a report that found serious problems with the FOIL process in city agencies : 40 % of City agencies lack information on their website about where to direct requests , making the process extremely challenging for the public to navigate , and one in ten requests was either ignored or fell through the cracks , with no response made within six months .

Last year , as part of an investigative series , Honolulu Civil Beat requested copies of the public records requests that had been filed between January 2011 and July 2013 .
